file_content.text: Did I ever tell you I have a fear of being shot to death on a forsaken frozen world?
The Republic won't surrender their resources easily. We might have to kill every last one of them.
The enemy is entrenched here. They are determined to repel any attack to their frozen resources.
I feel our enemy's determination and fear--we will leave them frozen in the ice.
Another frozen Republic base about to bite the dust. I'm jacked and ready to bring it.
Our enemy waits inside! We bring death!
Deeper, deeper into darkness. We are the Republic's nightmare.
Nothing like taking shots at the Republic to get the blood going. Good thing I spent all that time training my eyes for low-light combat.
Let's get in and out quickly, with minimal casualties. I'm still a little uneasy about fighting Republic soldiers.
Fascinating construction, building a base like this so quickly after arriving on Ilum. It won't last, of course. That's the tragedy. In ancient times, building was slow, but those buildings lasted.
Move swiftly and silently. The night and the snow are our allies. My people know Ilum well. Watch for ambushes from the cliffs.
Remember when attacking a Jedi fortress seemed like a bad idea? Yeah, me, neither.
We go to fight Jedi on a lost and distant world. A moment to remember.
I really am too old to be assaulting Jedi bases. But we rise to the challenges of our time....
Whatever happens, I'm proud to be a part of this assault. It'll go down in history.
If you do not survive this attack, I will retain a recording of the event for later analysis. Perhaps I will broadcast it.
According to the HoloNet, Ilum's over ninety percent ice. After Hoth, though, this actually seems kind of cozy.
This planet's supposed to be loaded with crystal formations, valuable crystal formations. Keep an eye out.
Jedi've been on Ilum for ages. Don't know why, but it's time to serve an eviction.
Blizz think this like when Blizz work for Slam.
Looks like we ain't gettin' a warm welcome 'til we torch the place.
Jedi Temple = invaded by Sith // Jedi + T7 = flush out that filth!
Let's show the Sith what happens when they squat in a Jedi Temple.
Not sure which is worse, Ilum or Hoth. Scratch that--I'm going with Ilum, because I'm on it.
Nobody invades a Jedi stronghold and gets away with it. Not on my watch.
Look on the bright side. The last time we attacked a Jedi Temple, we left you nothing to reclaim.
Is not like temple on Tython.
I know Jedi like to go without, but building a temple on such a frozen world is going too far.
Great defensive position wasted on a temple.
Carved right out of the stone. Guess the Jedi have architects as well as ambassadors.
Imagine training here. Going through that arch every day and looking up at the stars.
Fighting for a Jedi temple? What have we gotten ourselves into?
Fighting the Sith on Ilum is an honor. Bowdaar's legend grows.
I hope there's profit in this fight. We're risking a lot to help out the Jedi.
If the Jedi were true warriors, they would not have let this temple fall into Sith hands.
Hello, Sith! Just so we're clear, I'm not an actual Jedi. I only dress like one!
The Jedi Temple. Nice to see one that's almost in one piece.
This is the Jedi Temple. Files show that it's stood here for centuries--it's a very important structure in the Jedi Order.
The Jedi Temple! Quite impressive, as one would expect from our noble allies.
Guess that's the Jedi Temple--pretty impressive. Never guessed I'd be spending time in places like this.
This Jedi Temple shows the marks of centuries. Falling now would be a great shame.
Commentary: The Republic undesirables are well-fortified here. I almost feel sorry for them.
Lament: The Jedi have proved remarkably incapable of holding their temples, master. Am I the only one bothered by this?
